item.title: A TT-eigenvalue solver that finally works
item.description: In a recent preprint by Maxim Rakhuba and Ivan Oseledets we propose a new algorithm for calculation of vibrational spectra of molecules using tensor train decomposition. Under the assumption that eigenfunctions lie on a low-parametric manifold of low-rank tensors we introduce the concept of manifold preconditioning of well-known iterative methods …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Exponential machines and tensor trains
item.description: Modeling interactions between features improves the performance of machine learning solutions in many domains (e.g. recommender systems or sentiment analysis). In this paper, we introduce Exponential Machines (ExM), a predictor that models all interactions of every order. The key idea is to represent an exponentially large tensor of parameters …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Convergence analysis of a projected fixed-point iteration
item.description: In this paper by Denis Kolesnikov and Ivan Oseledets we analyse convergence of projected fixed-point iteration on a Riemannian manifold of matrices with fixed rank. As a retraction method we use `projector splitting scheme’. We prove that the projector splitting scheme converges at least with the same rate as standard …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Compress-and-eliminate solver for sparse matrices
item.description:
We propose a new Compress-and-Eliminate Solver for sparse matrices. The approach is proposed by Daria Sushnikova and Ivan Oseledets. The solver has a very simple algebraic structure, and outperfoms state-of-the art CHOLMOD software.

  • Preprint on arXiv
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: New paper in SIMAX
item.description:
Our paper on a new rational Krylov method for solving large-scale Lyapunov equations “From Low-Rank Approximation to a Rational Krylov Subspace Method for the Lyapunov Equation” by D. Kolesnikov and I. Oseledets is now published in SIAM Journal oon Matrix Analysis and Applications

  • Preprint on arXiv
  • Code on Github
  • Code …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: New paper in J. Comp. Phys
item.description: Our paper on low-rank computation of huge-dimensional path integrals “A low-rank approach to the computation of path integrals” by M. S. Litsarev and I. Oseledets published in Journal of Computational Physics
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: New paper in J. Chem. Phys
item.description: Our paper on multidimensional potential energy surfaces approximation] using a combination of active subspace methods and tensor train decomposition “Fitting high-dimensional potential energy surface using active subspace and tensor train (AS+TT) method” by V. Baranov and I. Oseledets is now published in Journal of Chemical Physics
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Anton Sukhinov leaves the group
item.description: Our research scientist Anton Sukhinov has finished working at Scientific Computing group. We thank Anton for his valuable contributions to the research agenda and for his work with the industrial partners (Huawei, Intel) and wish him good luck in his future career.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: MMMA-2015
item.description: We have succesfully hosted at Skoltech 4-th international conference on Matrices in Mathematics and Applications, MMMA-2015. More than 100 talks from 6 countries and 10 universities. This is the first conference at our new building of such, and we had many interesting talks and discussions. The talks and videos …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Path integrals & low-rank for unbounded domains
item.description:
Path integrals play a dominant role in description of a wide range of problems in physics and mathematics. They are a universal and powerful tool for condensed matter and high-energy physics, theory of stochastic processes and parabolic differential equations, financial modelling, quantum chemistry and many others.

The solution of the …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Cross-conv paper published!
item.description: Our cross-convolution paper “Fast Multidimensional Convolution in Low-Rank Tensor Formats via Cross Approximation” by M. Rakhuba, I. Oseledets is now published in SIAM Journal on Scientific Computing
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Similarity for heterogeneous networks
item.description:
We propose a generalization of SimRank similarity measure for heterogeneous information networks. Each node is associated with a set of objects and there are different possible relations. This is encoded into the adjacency tensor, and the TensorSimRank equation is given as

$$s_{\alpha \beta} = \sum_{\gamma} w_{\alpha \beta \gamma …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Time integration of tensor trains published!
item.description: Our paper on time integration of tensor trains “Time integration of tensor trains” by C. Lubich, I. Oseledets, B. Vandereycken is now published in SIAM Journal on Numerical Analysis
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Maximum-volume principle for rectangular matrices
item.description: A definition of p-volume of rectangular matrices is given. We generalize the results for square maximum-volume submatrices to the case rectangular maximal-volume submatrices and provide estimates for the growth of the coefficients. Three promising applications of such submatrices are presented: recommender systems, finding maximal elements in low-rank matrices and preconditioning …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Alexander Mikhalev defends his PhD
item.description:
Congratulations to Alexander Mikhalev for his successful PhD defense in INM RAS!

  • Dissertation (in Russian)
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Convolutional neural networks and tensors
item.description:
Deep learning is a huge topic today; speeding up the computation with convolutional neural network is crucial for fast classification. In this work we show how fine-tuned canonical polyadic (CP) decomposition can be used to speedup CNN by a factor of 8-10.

  • Preprint on arXiv
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Alternating low-rank method for the Lyapunov equation
item.description: Time-stepping free method based on the rational Krylov subspaces play an important role in many applications. The adaptative selection of the shifts for the construction of the RKS is crucial. In this paper we propose a new algorithm for the selection of the shifts. It is based on the connection …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Time evolution and optimization with MPS
item.description: The projector-splitting scheme in the TT/MPS format is a natural way to computing dynamics of quantum spin systems Hamiltonians with long-range interaction. We have proposed a unified approach that leads to a cheap and efficient computational scheme that can be applied to any Hamiltonian, represented in the MPO/TT …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Time integration of tensor trains
item.description:
Dynamical low-rank approximation is an efficient framework for solving continious and discrete-time problems in high-dimensions. Using the Dirac-Frenkel principle applied to the tensor-train format, we have propose a robust and efficient time integrator for the resulting system of nonlinear equations.

  • Preprint on arXiv
Algorithm scheme Approximate Laplace inversion
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Multidimensional integrals in ion-atom collisions
item.description: Simulation in physics is full of multidimensional integrals. In the paper M. S. Litsarev and I. V. Oseledets. Low rank approximations for the DEPOSIT computer code. arXiv preprint 1403.4068, 2014 we consider the DEPOSIT code that is suited for the computation of ion-atomic collisons. The main computational bottleneck is …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Preconditioners for hierarchical matrices
item.description: We continue to develop our h2tools package with the new functionality. The solution of linear systems with hierarchical matrices plays a crucial role in many applications. We use the sparse extended form of the H2-matrices to reduce the initial linear system to a block-structured linear system and then use this …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets

item.title: Convolution via cross approximation
item.description: Multidimensional convolution plays a crucial role in many applications. We have proposed a new method for approximate computation of the convolution in low-rank tensor formats that is based on the cross approximation in the frequency domain. The method is applicable to any SVD-based tensor format (skeleton, Tucker, Tensor Train …
item.dc:creator: Ivan Oseledets
